title: Senior Product Manager - Compliance Reporting
content:
Your mission:Your mission is to build convenient & scalable tooling and products around Wise’s exchange of knowledge regarding financial crime investigations and compliance checks with external partners, and FIUs. Your products support large operational teams and effectively mitigate financial crime risks with minimal negative impact on customers’ experience.This role is a unique opportunity to have an impact on Wise’s mission and push the limits of how financial crime risks are mitigated and large amounts of data is exchanged between different organisations.
Here’s how you’ll be contributing to the FinCrime Squad:You will work as part of the FinCrime product team which is responsible for keeping our customers money safeYour mission within your areas is to build world-class solutions that will help meet regulatory/partner requirements in a fast, reliable, scalable, safe and cost efficient way.You’ll be figuring out the vision and goals of the team, how to measure them and where to prioritise – you’ll inspire the team and define the product direction and run the road map together with them.You’ll communicate your goals and long term strategy in an engaging way, as well as keep the team moving towards the vision.You’ll work closely with operational teams to help them figure out how to streamline and automate manual processes.You’ll work closely with other product teams in launching new products and unifying processes, participating or driving cross-team initiatives.
This role will give you the opportunity to:Choose your path to impact – we believe people are most empowered when they can act autonomously. So rather than telling you what to do, you’ll work with your team to create a vision of your own. Of course, you can always gather feedback from smart, curious people across Wise but you’ll have the freedom to make your own callsTruly make the world a better place by helping reduce crime. You will be stopping money launderers and will have a very clear and real impact on people’s lives.Work with a group of amazing and dedicated product managers, engineers, analysts, and operations.Work with a modern microservices system with key parts written In-house, which allows to move fast and build controls and experiences that are above industry standards and push the boundaries of what is possible.Grow as a leader – Grow and inspire your team to join our missionBe part of our mission to make money without borders the new normal
A bit about you:You’re an experienced Product Manager with at least 3-5 years under your belt. - you have shipped products or product features, interpreted feedback and data and made important iterationsYou have worked with an operations team and built product capabilities that help operations grow sustainably, improve efficiency and reach operational excellence.You believe in the Wise mission and know how to inspire a team to dream big, align on a common vision, and draw a clear path to get thereYou're passionate about growing your team and getting the best out of people as well as continuing to grow and develop yourselfYou have a clear understanding of how systems are built, are able to effectively work with cross-functional stakeholders
Some extra skills that are great (but not essential):Experience in Risk or Compliance and evaluate product decisions with a risk impact mindsetWorking with distributed product & operational teams.Knowledge in the Financial Crime or Fraud domainSalary (monthly)€4.945—€6.720 EURWe're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.

questions.label: What gender identity do you most closely identify with?
I identify my race/ethnicity as (mark all that apply):

answer_options.label: Black or of African or Caribbean descent

Why would you like to work at Wise?
Tell us about a product that you've built.  How did you decide to build it and how did you measure its impact?
